rule: All function parameters and return types must have explicit type annotations
suggested_fix: Add types: function calculate(voltage: number, current: number): number

rule: Avoid using 'any' type - use specific types or 'unknown' if type is truly unknown
suggested_fix: Replace 'data: any' with proper type definition or 'unknown' for truly dynamic data

rule: Use type aliases or interfaces for complex types instead of inline object types
suggested_fix: Create 'interface User { name: string; age: number; }' instead of inline {name: string; age: number}

rule: Use TSDoc comments for public APIs, functions, and complex types
suggested_fix: Add /** @param x Description @returns Description */ for exported functions

rule: Use const for immutable values and let for mutable ones - never use var
suggested_fix: Replace 'var' with 'const' or 'let' based on whether the variable is reassigned

rule: Use 'readonly' modifier for class properties that shouldn't change after initialization
suggested_fix: Mark properties as 'readonly maxVoltage: number;' in class definitions

rule: Use camelCase for variables/functions, PascalCase for classes/interfaces/types, UPPER_CASE for constants
suggested_fix: Variables: motorSpeed, interfaces: IEnergyMonitor, constants: MAX_VOLTAGE

rule: Prefer interfaces over type aliases for object shapes
suggested_fix: Use 'interface User { }' instead of 'type User = { }' for extendable object types

rule: Use access modifiers (public, private, protected) in classes
suggested_fix: Add 'private', 'protected', or 'public' to all class members explicitly

rule: Make class properties private by default and expose only what's necessary
suggested_fix: Change 'voltage: number' to 'private voltage: number' and add public getters if needed

rule: No hardcoded credentials, API keys, or secrets
suggested_fix: Use environment variables via process.env or configuration management

rule: Enable strict null checks and handle null/undefined explicitly
suggested_fix: Use optional chaining obj?.prop or null checks if (obj !== null) before accessing properties

rule: Use const enums when possible to reduce bundle size
suggested_fix: Replace 'enum Status' with 'const enum Status' if enum is only used as values

rule: Use union types for variables that can have multiple specific types
suggested_fix: Use 'string | number' instead of 'any' when a value can be either type

rule: Use generics for reusable type-safe functions and classes
suggested_fix: Create generic functions: function getValue<T>(key: string): T instead of returning 'any'

rule: Properly type async functions with Promise<T> return types
suggested_fix: Add return type: async function fetchData(): Promise<User[]>

rule: Enable strict mode in tsconfig.json for maximum type safety
suggested_fix: Set 'strict': true in tsconfig.json compiler options

rule: Use ES6 imports instead of require() for type safety
suggested_fix: Replace 'const x = require('module')' with 'import x from 'module''

rule: Avoid type assertions (as Type) unless absolutely necessary
suggested_fix: Use type guards or proper typing instead of 'as' assertions to maintain type safety

rule: Use tuple types for fixed-length arrays with specific types
suggested_fix: Use 'type Point = [number, number]' instead of 'number[]' for coordinate pairs
